Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.frontend.actions Description

User action handlers for ODP operations.

Overview

This package contains action classes that handle user interactions in the ODP system. Actions extend the RDS SimpleForm framework's SimpleAction class and implement the Command pattern to execute business operations in response to user events (button clicks, menu selections, etc.).

Action Categories

Management Actions (IManageOdpAction)

Actions for creating and editing ODPs (require PROPOSER role):

  • NewOdpAction - Initiates new ODP creation workflow
  • CreateOdpAction - Saves new ODP to repository
  • EditOdpAction - Opens existing ODP for editing
  • UpdateOdpAction - Saves changes to existing ODP
  • SubmitOdpForApprovalAction - Submits ODP for authorization workflow

Approval Actions (IApprovalOdpAction)

Actions for authorization workflow (require approver roles):

  • OpenApprovalOdpFormAction - Opens ODP in approval form for review
  • ConfirmApprovalAction - Approves or rejects an ODP

Navigation Actions

Actions for form navigation and workflow transitions:

  • ConfirmCompanyAction - Confirms company selection and proceeds to detail form

Debug Actions (IOdpDebugAction)

Administrative/debug actions:

  • RestoreCsvRepositoryAction - Restores CSV repository from backup

Action Lifecycle

Execution Flow

  1. Security Check - OdpSecurityManager validates permissions
  2. Form Validation - Framework validates form fields
  3. Action Execution - getNextStateID(validated) called
  4. Business Logic - Action calls service layer
  5. Navigation - Action returns next form ID
  6. Refresh - Framework refreshes UI if needed

Key Methods


 public class SomeAction extends SimpleAction {
     // Returns unique action identifier
     public String getActionID();

     // Returns description shown in UI
     public String getDescr();

     // Returns icon and rendering settings
     public BusinessLogicActionRenderSettings getBusinessLogicActionRenderSettings();

     // Main execution logic
     public String getNextStateID(boolean validated) throws Exception {
         if (validated) {
             // Execute business logic
             // Return next form ID or null to stay on current form
         }
         return null;
     }
 }

Security Integration

Marker Interfaces

Actions implement marker interfaces for security categorization:

  • IManageOdpAction - Requires PROPOSER role
  • IApprovalOdpAction - Requires approver role (SIGNER_1, SIGNER_2, or PAYER)
  • IOdpDebugAction - Requires admin permissions

OdpSecurityManager

OdpSecurityManager enforces security by:

  • Checking user role against action requirements
  • Validating ODP state allows the action
  • Verifying ownership for edit/delete operations
  • Hiding/disabling unauthorized actions in UI

Service Integration

Actions access backend services through the form's application: 


 // Get service and user from application
 IOdpService service = form.getSimpleApplication().getIOdpService();
 OdpUser user = form.getSimpleApplication().getOdpUser();

 // Execute service operation
 String odpId = service.createOdp(odp, user.getUserId());

Data Flow

Create ODP Flow


 User fills form -> CreateOdpAction triggered
     |
 Action gets form data via OdpMapper
     |
 Action calls service.createOdp(odp, userId)
     |
 Service validates permissions and business rules
     |
 Repository persists ODP
     |
 Action returns "TASKS" form ID
     |
 Framework navigates to tasks form

Approval Flow


 User clicks approve -> ConfirmApprovalAction triggered
     |
 Action prompts for password
     |
 Action creates OdpAuthorizationStep
     |
 Action calls service.approveOdp(odpId, password, step)
     |
 Service validates password and permissions
     |
 Repository adds approval step, updates ODP state
     |
 Action refreshes tasks form

Common Patterns

Form Access


 public class MyAction extends SimpleAction {
     private final OdpDetailForm form;

     public MyAction(OdpDetailForm form) {
         this.form = form;
         setEnableSecurityManager(true); // Enable security checks
     }
 }

Data Grid Refresh


 // After modifying data, refresh the grid
 OdpTasksForm tasksForm = (OdpTasksForm) form.getSimpleForm("TASKS");
 tasksForm.resetDataGrid();

Form Navigation


 public String getNextStateID(boolean validated) throws Exception {
     if (validated) {
         // Execute logic
         return OdpAppConstants.FORM.TASKS.getId(); // Navigate to tasks form
     }
     return null; // Stay on current form
 }

Error Handling

Actions should handle errors appropriately:

  • Service layer IllegalStateException - Permission/state violations
  • Service layer IllegalArgumentException - Invalid data
  • Framework displays error messages to user
  • Actions can catch and transform exceptions for better UX
Version:
3.0

RDS Software
